intro: Zygia, commonly known as the golden bell, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rubiaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees native to tropical and subtropical regions. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes used in traditional medicine.
